result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse L. Reese was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full from bond on file.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse L. Reese

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jesse L. Reese
Current: W14846 Hwy 121, Hixton, WI 54635 United States  (Effective: 09-02-2015)
Prior: 123 S Park St, Alma Center, WI 54611

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  State moved to amend from felony to misdemeanor bond jumping.  Granted.  Defendant plead no contest to the amended charge.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, elements and constitutional rights with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights. Court found that a factual basis exists for plea.  Find guilty of count 1 as amended.  Joint recommendation 1 year probation concurrent with 14CF178.  CC and DNA sample and surcharge.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. Apply bond on file to costs.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.    Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.   Subject to random Kiosk testing at Jackson County Sheriffs Office.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.    Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.   Subject to random Kiosk testing at Jackson County Sheriffs Office.
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail, without cousel.  Cash bond set.  AIA set for 8/17/15 at 9:30 am.  Defendant advised to contact SPD.
